com.cleo.lexicom.external

Interface ILexiCom

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote

    public interface ILexiCom
extends java.rmi.Remote
    Establishes an interface with VersaLex. Refer to LexiComFactory.getVersaLex(int,String,int) or LexiComFactory.getCurrentInstance(). VersaLex nodes are always organized as follows: 
     REMOTE HOST
   |
   +--MAILBOX
   |    |
   |    +--ACTION
   |
   +--HOST_ACTION (VLTrader or Harmony only)
   |
   +--TRADING_PARTNER (LexiCom only)

 USERS HOST (VLTrader or Harmony only)
   |
   +--USER MAILBOX
   |    |
   |    +--ACTION
   |
   +--HOST_ACTION
   
 LOCAL LISTENER HOST
   |
   +--SERVICE

                              boolean overwrite)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Start an XML log file
        Parameters:
        filepath - the path of the XML log file to be created and started
        overwrite - if the log file already exists, true indicates the log file should be overwritten; false indicates the log file should be appended

      • importHost

        java.lang.String importHost(java.lang.String filepath,
                            java.lang.String host,
                            boolean replace)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Import and activate a host from an XML host file
        Parameters:
        filepath - the path of the XML host file to be imported and activated
        host - the desired alias of the new host (null for default); can start with a host folder path separated by LexUtil.beanSeparator
        replace - true if the host should be replaced if it already exists
        Returns:
        the alias of the new host
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • clone

        java.lang.String clone(int type,
                       java.lang.String[] path,
                       java.lang.String alias,
                       boolean replace,
                       boolean temporary)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Clone a new VersaLex element
        Parameters:
        type - either HOST, MAILBOX, TRADING_PARTNER, ACTION, or HOST_ACTION
        path - the alias path to the element to be cloned
        alias - the desired alias of the new element (null for default); if HOST, can start with a host folder path separated by LexUtil.beanSeparator
        replace - true if the element should be replaced if it already exists
        temporary - true if temporary usage element; valid for ACTION only and !replace
        Returns:
        the alias of the new element
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • startRun

        void startRun(int type,
              java.lang.String[] path,
              LexiComLogListener l,
              boolean wait)
       throws java.lang.Exception
        Starts running the host or action
        Parameters:
        type - either HOST, ACTION, or HOST_ACTION
        path - the alias path to the host/action/host-based action
        l - a LexiComLogListener that will be notified when log events have occurred for this host/action (can be null). This listener relative to this path will be automatically removed when the action finishes
        wait - true if should not return until host/action is done (overridden to false for local listener host)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • startRun

        void startRun(int type,
              java.lang.String[] path,
              LexiComLogListener l,
              boolean wait,
              java.lang.String stype)
       throws java.lang.Exception
        Starts running the host or action
        Parameters:
        type - either HOST, ACTION, or HOST_ACTION
        path - the alias path to the host/action/host-based action
        l - a LexiComLogListener that will be notified when log events have occurred for this host/action (can be null). This listener relative to this path will be automatically removed when the action finishes

        stype - defaults to "API" if not provided

        java.lang.Exception

        void startRun(int type,
              java.lang.String[] path,

              boolean wait,

              java.lang.String username)
       throws java.lang.Exception

        stype - defaults to "API" if not provided

      • getAbsolute

        java.lang.String getAbsolute(java.lang.String path)
                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        If file path is not an absolute path, then constructs one from the VersaLex user directory
        Parameters:
        path - either relative or absolute file path
        Returns:
        absolute file path
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if running in CLIENT mode and remote method invocation error

      • getAbsolute

        java.io.File getAbsolute(java.io.File file,
                         boolean getUnderlying)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        If getUnderlying is false, then this returns the same results as calling getAbsolute(path). If getUnderlying is true, then this retrieves the absolute path of the underlying file. If this is a file system file and is not an absolute path, it constructs one from the VersaLex user directory. If this is a URI path that has an underlying file system file, the absolute path of the file will be returned. If the URI path does not have an underlying file, the original URI path will be returned.
        Parameters:
        file - either relative or absolute file path
        getUnderlying - retrieves underlying file (if possible)
        Returns:
        absolute file
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if running in CLIENT mode and remote method invocation error

      • getAbsolute

        java.lang.String getAbsolute(java.lang.String path,
                             boolean getUnderlying)
                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        If getUnderlying is false, then this returns the same results as calling getAbsolute(file). If getUnderlying is true, then this retrieves the absolute path of the underlying file. If this is a file system file and is not an absolute path, it constructs one from the VersaLex user directory. If this is a URI path that has an underlying file system file, the absolute path of the file will be returned. If the URI path does not have an underlying file, the original URI path will be returned.
        Parameters:
        path - either relative or absolute file path
        getUnderlying - retrieves underlying file (if possible)
        Returns:
        absolute file path
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if running in CLIENT mode and remote method invocation error
